titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 384) to reform the Troubled Assets Relief Program of the Secretary of the Treasury and ensure accountability under such Program.
Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 384) to reform the Troubled Assets Relief Program of the Secretary of the Treasury and ensure accountability under such Program.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-2, by Mr. McGovern.

The resolution waives all points of order against consideration of the bill except those arising under clause 9 of rule XXI. The resolution provides that the Committee of the Whole shall rise without motion after general debate and that no further consideration of the bill shall occur except pursuant to a subsequent order of the House.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 2.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 53.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 191 (Roll no. 17).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 384 (TARP Reform and Accountability Act of 2009).
